input: fiscal deficit is likely to end up very close to its budgeted figure of birr 126bn 3.1 of gdp . government spending as of end-december 2020 was held below budgeted levels , at just birr 215bn for the six months or just 45 percent of the birr 476bn full year allocation . the budget deficit for the first half of the year was only birr 41bn versus a budgeted year total figure of birr 126bnor only 33 percent of the full year figure . this significant under-spending in the first six months has allowed for large unanticipated expenditures that have subsequently been allocated for exceptional outlays in recent months . reflecting these developments , more recent nine-month data point to a deficit of around birr 91bn , by our estimates , based on the change in the stock of domestic debt up by birr 66bn in the last nine months and in external borrowing up by a net of 667mn or birr 25bn over the same period . at around 72 percent of the annual deficit figure for the first nine months 91bn vs 126bn , it appears the annual deficit will be close to its budgeted figure of near 3 percent of gdp . with this deficit figure , and given a nominal gdp of birr 4.2 trillion this year , the debt ratio at end-june 2021 should remain roughly unchanged from its level of a year ago , or around 51 percent of gdp . a rising share of the governments domestic debt is now financed via treasury bills , and in fact 70 percent of governments new domestic borrowing birr 46bn out of birr 66bn as of march 2021 is now taking place at market interest rates , which have reached double- digit levels for the first time in the auctions history . this policy shift brings with it a somewhat higher cost of borrowing for the government 10 percent effective rate across all t-bill maturities , but it is at the same time welcome for making possible properly functioning money markets and for helping better reflect the opportunity costs of funds invested by banks and pension funds . banking the banking sector continues to show strong year-on-year growth in deposits and in lending , both of which are up around 28 percent from year ago levels . growth rates were even stronger at private banks where deposits were up 40 percent and lending up 46 percent from year-ago levels , while cbe showed a slowdown in credit growth despite a 20 percent growth in deposits . the likelihood of a major npl problem at private banks still appears very low and most banks are , in any case , well-provisioned and well-capitalized for any surprises on this front . nine-month data suggest record levels of income and profits will be reported by both the public and private banks when they close their financial year at the end of june 2021. balance of payments contrary to our expectations , fx reserves have been under pressure over the past quarter

views or opinions of the funds managing partners , advisors , or investors . 4 economic activityrecent developments the central statistical authority has just released final crop estimates for the current fiscal year , with figures showing 34.2mn tons of total agricultural production , or growth of 2 percent from last years 33.5mn tons . earlier forecasts from the ministry of agriculture officials had suggested that crop outturns may reach as high as 37mn tons , but actual outturns have turned out lower . seen by the major crop categories , the highest growth rates were registered in the production of pulses 6.5 and in cereals 1.8. the output of oilseeds fell by nearly 8 percent compared to the prior years outturns . this years 2 percent growth in crop output is the slowest seen in five years , and only one-third of the 6 percent average annual growth registered over the past decade . still , this years crop growth is noteworthy when seen against multiple adverse shocks experienced during the yearincluding locust invasions , conflict , and harvest disruptions . offsetting these adverse impacts were the positive effects of favourable rains , increased acreage farmed , 4 percent growth in services , and 9 percent growth in industry the latter mostly driven by construction , we estimate this years overall gdp growth will reach at least four percent . there is some current downside risks are that 1 farm output may be lower due to a disrupted planting season in northern ethiopia 2 constructionindustrial activity may show slower growth due to shortfalls in fiscalexternal financing and thus slower expansion in public investment and fdi , and 3 services growth may be more limited due to a slower rebound partly conflict-related in tourism and domestic retail activity . projections by various external institutions point to an average expected growth rate of 6.6 percent for the upcoming fiscal year , though most of these reflect forecasts from early imports wheat and the other foods categories which appears to mainly include large cooking oil imports . the few other categories showing positive import growth include fertilizers which reflect policy decisions to boost usage and textile fabrics which are inputs to industrial parks and consistent with rising ip exports . capital goods imports were also down across all main sub-categories , including a 13 percent drop for industrial capital goods . the only exception seen was for agricultural capital goods , but these are only around 2 percent of total capital goods imports . figure 20a parallel market rate moderated slightly in the last two months april , may versus the first quarter of the year , but it still remains significant at around 30 percent . exchange rate outlook looking ahead , it appears the central bank is comfortable with annual depreciation rates of near 23-25 percent given the current environment of still-elevated inflation and its apparent aim of avoiding a real appreciation of the currency . since we now expect inflation to remain mostly in the mid-teens for the rest of 2021 , it appears very likely that depreciation rates will stay elevated to offset what would otherwise be a loss in external competitiveness . we thus work with the assumption that year-on- year depreciation rates of 20-25 percent will persist for the rest of 2021 followed by
